items.title: Why New York Hospitals Will Soon Be More Transparent About Pricing
items.abstract: The City Council approved a bill enabling New Yorkers to go online and see what different hospitals charge for the same service.

items.title: States Are Silencing the Will of Millions of Voters
items.abstract: Texas is joining dozens of states that have asserted dominance over cities through a practice known as state pre-emption.

items.title: A Hiring Law Blazes a Path for A.I. Regulation
items.abstract: New York City’s pioneering, focused approach sets rules on how companies use the technology in work force decisions.

items.title: ‘Rip and Replace’: The Tech Cold War Is Upending Wireless Carriers
items.abstract: As China and the United States jockey for tech primacy, wireless carriers in dozens of states are tearing out Chinese equipment. That has turned into a costly, difficult process.

items.title: New York City Unveils ‘User-Friendly’ Way to Find Child Care Help
items.abstract: Eric Adams, who ran for mayor on a pledge to make it easier for poor New Yorkers to access city services, introduced an online portal called “MyCity.”
